questions.question_text: A team member has completed an assigned task. Which of the following roles should be notified FIRST?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I chose Answer C. Also, with "Project Team", this isn't necessarily a "role", which is one of the reasonings that I used to eliminate that as a possible answer.

Task initiation and completion are triggers for communication with the team about any effects on upcoming tasks. D is correct. The team member is notifying nobody. The Project Manager of the project is simply aware that "A team member has completed an assigned task."

comments.content:
Huh? The PM is the one to create the SOW, not the vendor. 
Heldman: "The project manager should be involved in the process of creating the SOW to ensure accuracy of the project requirements. Vendors use the SOW to determine whether they are capable of producing the deliverables and to determine their interest in bidding on your project work. "

discussion.content: The given answer appears to be correct. An RFP/RFQ goes out from the project group to a potential vendor, a SOW is generated by the potential vendor & given to the PM/Project Coordinator. The PM then weights his options and chooses the appropriate vendor that matches the criteria for the project.
RFP is the best choice up here to help the client solicit bids from vendors and pick up the best vendor to do the work. SOW details what you want the vendor to work on.

questions.question_text: A project manager would like to bring vendors into a new project. Which of the following documents should the potential vendors submit so the project manager can find the best vendors for the project?
questions.answer_description:
Explanation -
ג€If you're working with vendors to perform some or all of the work of the project, it's critical that they know exactly what you are asking them to do. The statement of work (SOW) details the goods or services you want to procure. In many respects it's similar to the project scope statement, except that it focuses on the work being procured. comments.content:
Actually, you must do an impact analysis first before submitting the change request. I think you may be confusing with logging the change request.

These are the steps on the ucertify:

1. Identify and document the change request
2. Track Requests in the change request log
3. Evaluate the impact and justification of the change
4. Disposition the request at the change control board and approve or deny
5. Implement the change
6. Validate the change and perform a quality check
7. Update the project management plan, update the appropriate project document, and apply version control
8.Coordinate and communicate with the appropriate stakeholder

discussion.content: I think this is actually supposed to be A. submit a change request. This is because first the change request has to be submitted, THEN it would be evaluated for its impact (B), THEN it approved or denied (C) and FINALLY the change would be communicated if it was approved. So answer i believe should be A.
222 CompTIA Project+ Cert Guide Once the formal change request is submitted, the project manager or other designated party should evaluate the impact of the requested change

Selected Answer: B
So the first step is absolutely going to be submitting a change request. That will start the ball rolling and get it added to the log and a number assigned to it. This request can be done by any stakeholder, team member, client, etc. So a team member wants to wants to enhance the code for his specific reason. 

The question asks what is the PROJECT MANAGER to do next? The PM will do the impact analysis with the SME, in this case I'm assuming the team member who wants to change code. Remember the team member isn't concerned with the same attributes of the project as the PM. So the team member may just want their sweet totally awesome code added because it would be better. The PM needs to look at it from all angles, time, budget, resources, risk, etc. 

Once the impact analysis is hammered out the PM will figure out who needs to approve it and hand it over to the CCB for decision. Then they either implement it or not and validate then document.

questions.question_text: A project manager is informed that a team member would like to enhance the code with an additional function. Which of the following should the project manager do NEXT?

choices.B: Evaluate the impact of the change.

discussion.content: A. What was done yesterday, what is planned for today, and what roadblocks need to be removed
If you see an answer with "plan week" for a daily scrum, it is dead wrong.

choices.B: What was done yesterday, what is planned for the week, and what issues were resolved
choices.A: What was done yesterday, what is planned for today, and what roadblocks need to be removed
choices.D: What was done yesterday, what is planned for this week, and what items from the backlog are priority
choices.C: What was done yesterday, what is planned for today, and what deliverables were completed
